- had previously shutdown eclipse OK (same build)
- restarted
- it exited with no error dialog, but had the following in the log
- in the workbench.xml, it had the following entry under <coolBarLayout> for

<coolItem id="group.editor" itemType="typeGroupMarker" />

I suspect this may be due to the recent changes to remove duplicate 
contributions with the same id.  The group marker for group.editors is added by 
the app, but is also getting restored from the workbench.xml.

There are several problems here:
1. the immediate one: IllegalArgumentException due to missing group.editors
2. the lack of error handling, resulting in this bringing down the Workbench
3. it should not have been trying to open the welcome editor anyway
  - I did not have it open in my previous session
  - no new features were layed down
  - the preference setting which remembers which features' welcome pages have 
already been shown got lost (actually, it looks like all prefs got lost -- 
there was no pref_store.ini in the metadata area for org.eclipse.ui.workbench)
  - I've seen this occasionally lately and will try to track it down

Created an attachment (id=8072)
My workbench.xml

The timestamp from the attached workbench.xml was 9:27am.  The failure above
occurred at 12:30.  So this does represent the state from the previous session.

The workbench.xml was not rewritten on exit.

Actually, it was caused by being in the middle of making changes when a build  
submission took place.  It is fixed in HEAD.  
  
Yes, it was the duplication code.  It occurs because of the ordering of events  
during start-up.  Certain basic cool bar items are added at start-up (seeding  
the workbench).  Then restoreState gets called.  The restoreState will attempt  
to add these contributions again, fail, and then try to blow away the old  
layout with its incomplete restored layout.  
  
Now, if the item is a duplicate, it makes sure the old one is put in the new  
layout.  

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 52549 ***
